icon.name: warning_ui_size
icon.tool_tip: WARNING: Using 'small' or 'big' interface size requires a restart. The UI is not designed for the 'small' or 'big' size, you will encounter problems.

icon.name: warning_font_dpi
icon.tool_tip: WARNING: Using a different DPI other than 96 will cause clipping text, broken labels, spacing issues and broken layouts, use with caution.

icon.name: warning_texture_memory
icon.tool_tip: WARNING: You might be allowing too much memory or even more than your GPU has available. Too high texture memory may cause drastic negative performance impact. Too low texture memory will cause faster texture trashing issues.

icon.name: warning_texture_compression
icon.tool_tip: WARNING: Using texture compression will save some texture memory but at a massive negative performance impact while loading textures and possible overarll as the Viewer spends most of its time processing textures.

check_box.label: Borderless Window Mode
check_box.tool_tip: Toggle between maximized borderless window mode and normal window mode.
check_box.name: FullscreenWindow

radio_item.label: Small
radio_item.tool_tip: This option changes the UI size to small. <blue>(0.8)</blue> <icon>ToolTip_Spacer</icon> <icon>Popup_Caution</icon> Changing this option needs a restart otherwise all onscreen actions to inworld will have an offset. It will break layouts, spacing, text labels and any sort of consistency in the UI.

radio_item.label: Medium
radio_item.tool_tip: This option changes the UI size to medium. <blue>(1.0)</blue> <icon>ToolTip_Spacer</icon> <icon>Popup_Caution</icon> Changing this option needs a restart otherwise all onscreen actions to inworld will have an offset. It will break layouts, spacing, text labels and any sort of consistency in the UI.

radio_item.label: Big
radio_item.tool_tip: This option changes the UI size to big. <blue>(1.2)</blue> <icon>ToolTip_Spacer</icon> <icon>Popup_Caution</icon> Changing this option needs a restart otherwise all onscreen actions to inworld will have an offset. It will break layouts, spacing, text labels and any sort of consistency in the UI.

radio_item.label: Huge (4k)
radio_item.tool_tip: This option changes the UI size to huge. <blue>(2.0)</blue> <icon>ToolTip_Spacer</icon> <icon>Popup_Caution</icon> Changing this option needs a restart otherwise all onscreen actions to inworld will have an offset. It will break layouts, spacing, text labels and any sort of consistency in the UI.

slider.label: Font DPI:
slider.tool_tip: Font DPI controls the size of all text in the Viewer. Changing this will break layouts, spacing and cause many parts of the UI to clip, overlap and sometimes be completely unreadable.
slider.name: DPI

check_box.label: Enable OpenGL 3.0 Texture Compression
check_box.tool_tip: <icon>Stat_Dot3</icon> Performance <icon>Stat_Dot0</icon> Graphics <icon>ToolTip_Spacer</icon>This option enables texture compression, this will save some texture memory but will cause artifacts on textures and will impact the performance negatively.
check_box.name: CompressTextures

check_box.label: Automatic Memory Management
check_box.tool_tip: This option enables automatically raising or lowering the memory limits depending on how much is currently used to minimize the empty unused reserved memory to a minimum.
check_box.name: CompressTextures

slider.tool_tip: This option controls the amount of video memory in MB (megabytes) to be used for permanent and semi-permanent texture storage such as UI textures and textures loaded from the SIM.
slider.label: System Memory (MB):
slider.name: SystemMemory

slider.tool_tip: This option controls the amount of video memory in MB (megabytes) to be used for rendering all the textures in the currently visible scene. It should be roughly 70%-80% the size of Texture Memory.
slider.label: Scene Memory (MB):
slider.name: SceneMemory

progress_bar.tool_tip: This display shows roughly how much video memory is being used.
progress_bar.name: progress_bar

icon.name: warning_dynamic_lod
icon.tool_tip: WARNING: Disabling Dynamic Level of Detail will make all object quality solely dependant on the 'Object Quality' setting, all objects will use the same level of detail no matter their distance to the camera.

icon.name: warning_object_lod
icon.tool_tip: WARNING: Object Quality beyond 'medium' may have a negative impact on performance especially with sculpts and meshes.

icon.name: warning_reflection_quality
icon.tool_tip: WARNING: Higher than 'normal' Reflection Quality may noticably impact performance negatively.

icon.name: warning_sky_quality
icon.tool_tip: WARNING: Higher than 'high' Sky Quality may have a slight negative impact on performance without any noticable visual improvements.

check_box.label: Use Dynamic Level of Detail
check_box.tool_tip: <icon>Stat_Dot0</icon> Performance <icon>Stat_Dot0</icon> Graphics <icon>ToolTip_Spacer</icon>This option toggles dynamic Level-of-Detail which automatically adjusts the detail of meshes, prims and sculpts depending on distance.
check_box.name: DynamicLOD

radio_item.label: Very Low
radio_item.tool_tip: <icon>Stat_Dot1</icon> Performance <icon>Stat_Dot1</icon> Graphics <icon>ToolTip_Spacer</icon>This option controls how much detail objects should have and which Level-of-Detail they use. <blue>(0.25)</blue>

radio_item.label: Low
radio_item.tool_tip: <icon>Stat_Dot1</icon> Performance <icon>Stat_Dot2</icon> Graphics <icon>ToolTip_Spacer</icon>This option controls how much details objects should have and which Level-of-Detail they use. <blue>(0.5)</blue>

radio_item.label: Medium
radio_item.tool_tip: <icon>Stat_Dot2</icon> Performance <icon>Stat_Dot2</icon> Graphics <icon>ToolTip_Spacer</icon>This option controls how much details objects should have and which Level-of-Detail they use. <blue>(1.0)</blue> <icon>ToolTip_Spacer</icon><icon>Default_Widget</icon> This option is equivalent of the maximum (Ultra) available in the official Viewer, this should be kept in mind when building with this option set higher than this.

radio_item.label: High
radio_item.tool_tip: <icon>Stat_Dot2</icon> Performance <icon>Stat_Dot2</icon> Graphics <icon>ToolTip_Spacer</icon>This option controls how much details objects should have and which Level-of-Detail they use. <blue>(2.0)</blue>

radio_item.label: Very High
radio_item.tool_tip: <icon>Stat_Dot2</icon> Performance <icon>Stat_Dot2</icon> Graphics <icon>ToolTip_Spacer</icon>This option controls how much details objects should have and which Level-of-Detail they use. <blue>(3.0)</blue>

radio_item.label: Ultra
radio_item.tool_tip: <icon>Stat_Dot2</icon> Performance <icon>Stat_Dot2</icon> Graphics <icon>ToolTip_Spacer</icon>This option controls how much details objects should have and which Level-of-Detail they use. <blue>(4.0)</blue>

radio_item.label: Very Low
radio_item.tool_tip: <icon>Stat_Dot0</icon> Performance <icon>Stat_Dot1</icon> Graphics <icon>ToolTip_Spacer</icon>This option controls how much details default linden bodies should have and which Level-of-Detail they use. <blue>(0.5)</blue>

radio_item.label: Low
radio_item.tool_tip: <icon>Stat_Dot0</icon> Performance <icon>Stat_Dot1</icon> Graphics <icon>ToolTip_Spacer</icon>This option controls how much details default linden bodies should have and which Level-of-Detail they use. <blue>(1.0)</blue>

radio_item.label: Medium
radio_item.tool_tip: <icon>Stat_Dot0</icon> Performance <icon>Stat_Dot1</icon> Graphics <icon>ToolTip_Spacer</icon>This option controls how much details default linden bodies should have and which Level-of-Detail they use. <blue>(2.0)</blue> <icon>ToolTip_Spacer</icon><icon>Default_Widget</icon> This option is equivalent of the maximum (Ultra) available in the official Viewer, this should be kept in mind when building with this option set higher than this.

radio_item.label: High
radio_item.tool_tip: <icon>Stat_Dot0</icon> Performance <icon>Stat_Dot1</icon> Graphics <icon>ToolTip_Spacer</icon>This option controls how much details default linden bodies should have and which Level-of-Detail they use. <blue>(5.0)</blue>

radio_item.label: Very High
radio_item.tool_tip: <icon>Stat_Dot0</icon> Performance <icon>Stat_Dot1</icon> Graphics <icon>ToolTip_Spacer</icon>This option controls how much details default linden bodies should have and which Level-of-Detail they use. <blue>(10.0)</blue>

radio_item.label: Very Low
radio_item.tool_tip: <icon>Stat_Dot0</icon> Performance <icon>Stat_Dot1</icon> Graphics <icon>ToolTip_Spacer</icon>This option controls how much details the terrain should have and which Level-of-Detail it uses. <blue>(0.5)</blue>

radio_item.label: Low
radio_item.tool_tip: <icon>Stat_Dot0</icon> Performance <icon>Stat_Dot1</icon> Graphics <icon>ToolTip_Spacer</icon>This option controls how much details the terrain should have and which Level-of-Detail it uses. <blue>(1.0)</blue>

radio_item.label: Medium
radio_item.tool_tip: <icon>Stat_Dot0</icon> Performance <icon>Stat_Dot1</icon> Graphics <icon>ToolTip_Spacer</icon>This option controls how much details the terrain should have and which Level-of-Detail it uses. <blue>(2.0)</blue> <icon>ToolTip_Spacer</icon><icon>Default_Widget</icon> This option is equivalent of the maximum (Ultra) available in the official Viewer, this should be kept in mind when building with this option set higher than this.

radio_item.label: High
radio_item.tool_tip: <icon>Stat_Dot0</icon> Performance <icon>Stat_Dot1</icon> Graphics <icon>ToolTip_Spacer</icon>This option controls how much details the terrain should have and which Level-of-Detail it uses. <blue>(5.0)</blue>

radio_item.label: Very High
radio_item.tool_tip: <icon>Stat_Dot0</icon> Performance <icon>Stat_Dot1</icon> Graphics <icon>ToolTip_Spacer</icon>This option controls how much details the terrain should have and which Level-of-Detail it uses. <blue>(10.0)</blue>

radio_item.label: Ultra
radio_item.tool_tip: <icon>Stat_Dot0</icon> Performance <icon>Stat_Dot1</icon> Graphics <icon>ToolTip_Spacer</icon>This option controls how much details the terrain should have and which Level-of-Detail it uses. <blue>(15.0)</blue>

radio_item.label: Off
radio_item.tool_tip: <icon>Stat_Dot1</icon> Performance <icon>Stat_Dot1</icon> Graphics <icon>ToolTip_Spacer</icon>This option controls how much details trees should have and which Level-of-Detail they use. <blue>(Disabled)</blue>

radio_item.label: Low
radio_item.tool_tip: <icon>Stat_Dot1</icon> Performance <icon>Stat_Dot2</icon> Graphics <icon>ToolTip_Spacer</icon>This option controls how much details trees should have and which Level-of-Detail they use. <blue>(0.5)</blue>

radio_item.label: Medium
radio_item.tool_tip: <icon>Stat_Dot1</icon> Performance <icon>Stat_Dot2</icon> Graphics <icon>ToolTip_Spacer</icon>This option controls how much details trees should have and which Level-of-Detail they use. <blue>(1.0)</blue> <icon>ToolTip_Spacer</icon><icon>Default_Widget</icon> This option is equivalent of the maximum (Ultra) available in the official Viewer, this should be kept in mind when building with this option set higher than this.

radio_item.label: High
radio_item.tool_tip: <icon>Stat_Dot1</icon> Performance <icon>Stat_Dot2</icon> Graphics <icon>ToolTip_Spacer</icon>This option controls how much details trees should have and which Level-of-Detail they use. <blue>(2.5)</blue>

radio_item.label: Very High
radio_item.tool_tip: <icon>Stat_Dot1</icon> Performance <icon>Stat_Dot2</icon> Graphics <icon>ToolTip_Spacer</icon>This option controls how much details trees should have and which Level-of-Detail they use. <blue>(5.0)</blue>

radio_item.label: Ultra
radio_item.tool_tip: <icon>Stat_Dot1</icon> Performance <icon>Stat_Dot2</icon> Graphics <icon>ToolTip_Spacer</icon>This option controls how much details trees should have and which Level-of-Detail they use. <blue>(10.0)</blue>

radio_item.label: Very Low
radio_item.tool_tip: <icon>Stat_Dot0</icon> Performance <icon>Stat_Dot0</icon> Graphics <icon>ToolTip_Spacer</icon>This option controls how much details the sky has and how smooth the sun is. <blue>(32)</blue>

radio_item.label: Low
radio_item.tool_tip: <icon>Stat_Dot0</icon> Performance <icon>Stat_Dot1</icon> Graphics <icon>ToolTip_Spacer</icon>This option controls how much details the sky has and how smooth the sun is. <blue>(64)</blue>

radio_item.label: Normal
radio_item.tool_tip: <icon>Stat_Dot1</icon> Performance <icon>Stat_Dot1</icon> Graphics <icon>ToolTip_Spacer</icon>This option controls how much details the sky has and how smooth the sun is. <blue>(96)</blue>

radio_item.label: High
radio_item.tool_tip: <icon>Stat_Dot1</icon> Performance <icon>Stat_Dot1</icon> Graphics <icon>ToolTip_Spacer</icon>This option controls how much details the sky has and how smooth the sun is. <blue>(128)</blue> <icon>ToolTip_Spacer</icon><icon>Default_Widget</icon> This option is equivalent of the maximum (Ultra) available in the official Viewer, this should be kept in mind when building with this option set higher than this.

radio_item.label: Very High
radio_item.tool_tip: <icon>Stat_Dot1</icon> Performance <icon>Stat_Dot1</icon> Graphics <icon>ToolTip_Spacer</icon>This option controls how much details the sky has and how smooth the sun is. <blue>(192)</blue>

radio_item.label: Ultra
radio_item.tool_tip: <icon>Stat_Dot2</icon> Performance <icon>Stat_Dot1</icon> Graphics <icon>ToolTip_Spacer</icon>This option controls how much details the sky has and how smooth the sun is. <blue>(256)</blue>

check_box.label: Enable Avatar Physics Simulation
check_box.tool_tip: <icon>Stat_Dot1</icon> Performance <icon>Stat_Dot1</icon> Graphics <icon>ToolTip_Spacer</icon>This option toggles Avatar Physics on or off. It simulates gravity and physical interaction for breasts, the butt and belly.
check_box.name: AvatarPhysics

radio_item.label: Very Low
radio_item.tool_tip: <icon>Stat_Dot1</icon> Performance <icon>Stat_Dot1</icon> Graphics <icon>ToolTip_Spacer</icon>This option controls how much time should be spend on calculating avatar physics. <blue>(0.1)</blue>

radio_item.label: Low
radio_item.tool_tip: <icon>Stat_Dot1</icon> Performance <icon>Stat_Dot1</icon> Graphics <icon>ToolTip_Spacer</icon>This option controls how much time should be spend on calculating avatar physics. <blue>(0.2)</blue>

radio_item.label: Medium
radio_item.tool_tip: <icon>Stat_Dot1</icon> Performance <icon>Stat_Dot1</icon> Graphics <icon>ToolTip_Spacer</icon>This option controls how much time should be spend on calculating avatar physics. <blue>(0.4)</blue>

radio_item.label: High
radio_item.tool_tip: <icon>Stat_Dot1</icon> Performance <icon>Stat_Dot1</icon> Graphics <icon>ToolTip_Spacer</icon>This option controls how much time should be spend on calculating avatar physics. <blue>(0.6)</blue>

radio_item.label: Very High
radio_item.tool_tip: <icon>Stat_Dot1</icon> Performance <icon>Stat_Dot1</icon> Graphics <icon>ToolTip_Spacer</icon>This option controls how much time should be spend on calculating avatar physics. <blue>(0.8)</blue>

radio_item.label: Ultra
radio_item.tool_tip: <icon>Stat_Dot1</icon> Performance <icon>Stat_Dot1</icon> Graphics <icon>ToolTip_Spacer</icon>This option controls how much time should be spend on calculating avatar physics. <blue>(1.0)</blue> <icon>ToolTip_Spacer</icon><icon>Default_Widget</icon> This option is equivalent of the maximum (Ultra) available in the official Viewer, this should be kept in mind when building with this option set higher than this.

check_box.label: Use Water Mip-maps
check_box.tool_tip: <icon>Stat_Dot1</icon> Performance <icon>Stat_Dot1</icon> Graphics <icon>ToolTip_Spacer</icon>This option toggles the usage of Mip-Maps on water. Mip-Mapping will use textures with lower resolutions to prevent artifacts and pixelation with high detail density.
check_box.name: MipMaps

radio_item.label: None
radio_item.tool_tip: <icon>Stat_Dot0</icon> Performance <icon>Stat_Dot0</icon> Graphics <icon>ToolTip_Spacer</icon>This option prevents everything from being reflected in water reflections.

radio_item.label: Terrain
radio_item.tool_tip: <icon>Stat_Dot1</icon> Performance <icon>Stat_Dot1</icon> Graphics <icon>ToolTip_Spacer</icon>This option allows the terrain to be reflected in water reflections.

radio_item.label: Objects
radio_item.tool_tip: <icon>Stat_Dot2</icon> Performance <icon>Stat_Dot2</icon> Graphics <icon>ToolTip_Spacer</icon>This option allows the terrain and objects to be reflected in water reflections.

radio_item.label: Avatars
radio_item.tool_tip: <icon>Stat_Dot2</icon> Performance <icon>Stat_Dot2</icon> Graphics <icon>ToolTip_Spacer</icon>This option allows the terrain, objects and avatars to be reflected in water reflections.

radio_item.label: Everything
radio_item.tool_tip: <icon>Stat_Dot2</icon> Performance <icon>Stat_Dot2</icon> Graphics <icon>ToolTip_Spacer</icon>This option allows everything to be reflected in water reflections.

radio_item.label: Very Low
radio_item.tool_tip: <icon>Stat_Dot0</icon> Performance <icon>Stat_Dot1</icon> Graphics <icon>ToolTip_Spacer</icon>This option controls the resolution of water reflections. <blue>(256x256)</blue>

radio_item.label: Low
radio_item.tool_tip: <icon>Stat_Dot1</icon> Performance <icon>Stat_Dot1</icon> Graphics <icon>ToolTip_Spacer</icon>This option controls the resolution of water reflections. <blue>(512x512)</blue>

radio_item.label: Normal
radio_item.tool_tip: <icon>Stat_Dot1</icon> Performance <icon>Stat_Dot1</icon> Graphics <icon>ToolTip_Spacer</icon>This option controls the resolution of water reflections. <blue>(768x768)</blue> <icon>ToolTip_Spacer</icon><icon>Default_Widget</icon> This option is equivalent of the maximum (Ultra) available in the official Viewer, this should be kept in mind when building with this option set higher than this.

radio_item.label: High
radio_item.tool_tip: <icon>Stat_Dot2</icon> Performance <icon>Stat_Dot1</icon> Graphics <icon>ToolTip_Spacer</icon>This option controls the resolution of water reflections. <blue>(1024x1024)</blue>

radio_item.label: Very High
radio_item.tool_tip: <icon>Stat_Dot2</icon> Performance <icon>Stat_Dot1</icon> Graphics <icon>ToolTip_Spacer</icon>This option controls the resolution of water reflections. <blue>(1536x1536)</blue>

radio_item.label: Ultra
radio_item.tool_tip: <icon>Stat_Dot3</icon> Performance <icon>Stat_Dot1</icon> Graphics <icon>ToolTip_Spacer</icon>This option controls the resolution of water reflections. <blue>(2048x2048)</blue>

radio_item.label: Very Low
radio_item.tool_tip: <icon>Stat_Dot0</icon> Performance <icon>Stat_Dot1</icon> Graphics <icon>ToolTip_Spacer</icon>This option controls the repeats of the default terrain textures. Higher means less repeats. <blue>(20)</blue>

radio_item.label: Low
radio_item.tool_tip: <icon>Stat_Dot0</icon> Performance <icon>Stat_Dot1</icon> Graphics <icon>ToolTip_Spacer</icon>This option controls the repeats of the default terrain textures. Higher means less repeats. <blue>(16)</blue>

radio_item.label: Medium
radio_item.tool_tip: <icon>Stat_Dot0</icon> Performance <icon>Stat_Dot1</icon> Graphics <icon>ToolTip_Spacer</icon>This option controls the repeats of the default terrain textures. Higher means less repeats. <blue>(12)</blue>

radio_item.label: High
radio_item.tool_tip: <icon>Stat_Dot0</icon> Performance <icon>Stat_Dot1</icon> Graphics <icon>ToolTip_Spacer</icon>This option controls the repeats of the default terrain textures. Higher means less repeats. <blue>(9)</blue>

radio_item.label: Very High
radio_item.tool_tip: <icon>Stat_Dot0</icon> Performance <icon>Stat_Dot1</icon> Graphics <icon>ToolTip_Spacer</icon>This option controls the repeats of the default terrain textures. Higher means less repeats. <blue>(6)</blue>

radio_item.label: Ultra
radio_item.tool_tip: <icon>Stat_Dot0</icon> Performance <icon>Stat_Dot1</icon> Graphics <icon>ToolTip_Spacer</icon>This option controls the repeats of the default terrain textures. Higher means less repeats. <blue>(5)</blue>

radio_item.label: Low
radio_item.tool_tip: <icon>Stat_Dot0</icon> Performance <icon>Stat_Dot1</icon> Graphics <icon>ToolTip_Spacer</icon>This option controls the resolution of post processing glow. <blue>(7)</blue>

radio_item.label: Normal
radio_item.tool_tip: <icon>Stat_Dot1</icon> Performance <icon>Stat_Dot1</icon> Graphics <icon>ToolTip_Spacer</icon>This option controls the resolution of post processing glow. <blue>(9)</blue> <icon>ToolTip_Spacer</icon><icon>Default_Widget</icon> This option is equivalent of the maximum (Ultra) available in the official Viewer, this should be kept in mind when building with this option set higher than this.

radio_item.label: High
radio_item.tool_tip: <icon>Stat_Dot1</icon> Performance <icon>Stat_Dot1</icon> Graphics <icon>ToolTip_Spacer</icon>This option controls the resolution of post processing glow. <blue>(10)</blue>

icon.name: warning_object_occlusion
icon.tool_tip: WARNING: Object-Object Occlusion may cause overall performance degradation, its usually worse in open but can be a lot better in enclosed areas.

icon.name: warning_avatars_visible
icon.tool_tip: WARNING: A lot maximum visible avatars on screen may cause absolutely unusable performance depending on hardware and the detail of shown avatars.

icon.name: warning_derender_kb
icon.tool_tip: WARNING: Heavy weight avatars (in KB) may cause a lot of traffic, high performance degradation and quick texture trashing.

icon.name: warning_derender_m2
icon.tool_tip: WARNING: Avatars with a lot of attachment surface (in m²) may cause high performance degradation and even crash you as high square meters are often a possible indicator for graphic crashers.

icon.name: warning_derender_ar
icon.tool_tip: WARNING: High complexity avatars (AR) may cause high performance degradation, quick texture trashing, unstable framerates and possibly even freezes or crashes depending on your hardware.

icon.name: warning_derender_surface
icon.tool_tip: WARNING: High surface areas are often used for crashing purposes, everything beyond 200m² can safely be ignored as its very likely that it is of malicious nature or simply not worth rendering.

icon.name: warning_draw_distance
icon.tool_tip: WARNING: Draw Distance has a high impact on performance for almost no visual gains in every day usage.

slider.label: Draw Distance:
slider.name: FarClip
slider.tool_tip: <icon>Stat_Dot4</icon> Performance <icon>Stat_Dot2</icon> Graphics <icon>ToolTip_Spacer</icon>This option controls your view distance in meters, starting from your camera.

slider.label: Particle Amount:
slider.name: MaxParticles
slider.tool_tip: <icon>Stat_Dot3</icon> Performance <icon>Stat_Dot1</icon> Graphics <icon>ToolTip_Spacer</icon>This option controls the maximum amount of particles rendered on screen.

check_box.label: Render Attached Particles
check_box.tool_tip: This option toggles particles attached to avatars on or off. Useful for particle spammers
check_box.name: attached_particles

check_box.label: Enable Anisotropic Filtering
check_box.tool_tip: <icon>Stat_Dot1</icon> Performance <icon>Stat_Dot2</icon> Graphics <icon>ToolTip_Spacer</icon>This option toggles Anisotropic Filtering which filters textures to prevent them from becoming blurry at certain camera angles.
check_box.name: ani

check_box.label: Enable Fullbright
check_box.tool_tip: This option controls whether the Viewer should ignore the legacy fullbright flag on object surfaces. WARNING! - Does not work with prim param LIGHT script command and emmisive masks!
check_box.name: EnableFullbright

check_box.label: Use Object-Object Occlusion
check_box.tool_tip: <icon>Stat_Dot2</icon> Performance <icon>Stat_Dot0</icon> Graphics <icon>ToolTip_Spacer</icon>This option toggles rendering of objects that are occluded by other objects. Can boost your performance depending on how much it is used. It will hurt your performance in open areas.
check_box.name: UseOcclusion

check_box.label: Use Stream Draw
check_box.name: vbostream
check_box.tool_tip: This option controls whether the Viewer should draw updates per frame (Dynamic) or per render (Stream). Driver/GPU tweak may alter rendering bandwidth.

check_box.label: Use Plugin Read Thread
check_box.tool_tip: Use a seperate thread to read incoming messages from plugins like Webprims etc.
check_box.name: PluginUseReadThread

check_box.label: Use Far Clip
check_box.tool_tip: This option toggles whether the Viewer should render the fourth (last) segment of the camera view distance or not.
check_box.name: RenderUseFarClip

slider.label: Background Yield Time:
slider.tool_tip: This option controls the time in ms (miliseconds) Viewer updates should be held back when the Viewer is not focused. 40ms = ~18 FPS.
slider.name: BackgroundYieldTime

slider.label: Max Frames Per Second:
slider.tool_tip: This option controls the frames in seconds the Viewer updates the rendering. Lower values increase the delay for actions to be processed. It is not recommended to set this below 20.
slider.name: FramePerSecondLimit

check_box.label: Render Unloaded Avatars
check_box.tool_tip: This option toggles whether the Viewer should render avatars that are not yet fully loaded (clouds) as clouds or their still-in-progress loading avatars.
check_box.name: UnloadedAvatars

slider.label: Max. Avatars Visible:
slider.tool_tip: <icon>Stat_Dot3</icon> Performance <icon>Stat_Dot2</icon> Graphics <icon>ToolTip_Spacer</icon>This option controls the maximum amount of avatars rendered on screen at any given time. Any more avatars will be automatically displayed as impostors (2D sprites).
slider.name: RenderAvatarMaxVisible

check_box.label: Always Render Friends
check_box.tool_tip: This option toggles whether the Viewer should always fully render friends regardless of your Jelly Doll settings.
check_box.name: AlwaysRenderFriends

slider.tool_tip: <icon>Stat_Dot3</icon> Performance <icon>Stat_Dot2</icon> Graphics <icon>ToolTip_Spacer</icon>This option controls the maximum total surface area in m² any avatar may have before it is automatically jelly dolled (colored 2D sprite).
slider.label: Avatars > Surface m²:
slider.name: RenderAutoMuteSurfaceAreaLimit

slider.tool_tip: <icon>Stat_Dot3</icon> Performance <icon>Stat_Dot2</icon> Graphics <icon>ToolTip_Spacer</icon>This option controls the maximum total Avatar Complexity (AR) any avatar may have before it is automatically jelly dolled (colored 2D sprite).
slider.label: Avatars > Complexity:
slider.name: RenderAvatarMaxComplexity

slider.tool_tip: <icon>Stat_Dot3</icon> Performance <icon>Stat_Dot2</icon> Graphics <icon>ToolTip_Spacer</icon>This option controls the maximum surface area in m² any single object may have before it is automatically derendered.
slider.label: Objects > Surface m²:
slider.name: RenderAutoHideSurfaceAreaLimit

slider.tool_tip: This option controls how often glow should be applied.
slider.label: Glow Iterations:
slider.name: Iterations

slider.tool_tip: This option controls the strength of glow.
slider.label: Glow Strength:
slider.name: Strength

slider.tool_tip: This option controls the minimum luminance required to consider something glowing.
slider.label: Glow Min. Luminance:
slider.name: MinLuminance

slider.tool_tip: This option controls the amount of soft ambient glow applied when something is not directly glowing via the object glow parameter.
slider.label: Glow Warmth:
slider.name: Warmth

slider.tool_tip: This option controls the width of all glow effects.
slider.label: Glow Width:
slider.name: Width

slider.tool_tip: This option controls how much glow should be extracted out of the alpha channel for glow, higher values makes ambient glow stronger.
slider.label: Glow Max. Alpha:
slider.name: MaxAlpha

slider.tool_tip: This option controls how much glow luminance should be weighted towards the red color channel.
slider.label: Luminance Weight Red:
slider.name: RenderGlowLumWeights_X

slider.tool_tip: This option controls how much glow luminance should be weighted towards the green color channel.
slider.label: Luminance Weight Green:
slider.name: RenderGlowLumWeights_Y

slider.tool_tip: This option controls how much glow luminance should be weighted towards the blue color channel.
slider.label: Luminance Weight Blue:
slider.name: RenderGlowLumWeights_Z

slider.tool_tip: This option controls how much the ambient glow should be weighted towards the red color channel.
slider.label: Warmth Red:
slider.name: RenderGlowWarmthWeights_X

slider.tool_tip: This option controls how much the ambient glow should be weighted towards the green color channel.
slider.label: Warmth Green:
slider.name: RenderGlowWarmthWeights_Y

slider.tool_tip: This option controls how much the ambient glow should be weighted towards the blue color channel.
slider.label: Warmth Blue:
slider.name: RenderGlowWarmthWeights_Z

check_box.label: Deferred Rendering
check_box.tool_tip: <icon>Stat_Dot2</icon> Performance <icon>Stat_Dot4</icon> Graphics <icon>ToolTip_Spacer</icon>This option toggles Deferred Rendering, improves and softens lighting, allows infinite light sources, directional projector lights, realtime shadows, Screen Space Ambient Occlusion (SSAO) and more. This option is absolutely required for any of the advanced effects and tweaks to be visible.
check_box.name: Deferred

icon.name: warning_fxaa
icon.tool_tip: WARNING: FXAA has basically zero impact on performance, not using it will cause aliasing on edges and may impact overall visual fidelity negatively.

icon.name: warning_shadow_resolution
icon.tool_tip: WARNING: Using high shadow resolutions may have a huge negative impact on performance depending on the complexity of the scene.

icon.name: warning_projector_resolution
icon.tool_tip: WARNING: High projector shadow resolutions may have a slight to medium impact on performance with very little visual improvement.

icon.name: warning_ssr
icon.tool_tip: WARNING: Screen Space Reflections may cause drastic performance degradation depending on the surface it is rendered on and the screen space resolution used.

check_box.label: Render World Lights
check_box.tool_tip: <icon>Stat_Dot1</icon> Performance <icon>Stat_Dot2</icon> Graphics <icon>ToolTip_Spacer</icon>This option toggles unattached normal and projected lights in Deferred Rendering on or off.
check_box.name: RenderDeferredLights

check_box.label: Render Other Attached Lights
check_box.tool_tip: <icon>Stat_Dot1</icon> Performance <icon>Stat_Dot1</icon> Graphics <icon>ToolTip_Spacer</icon>This option toggles rendering attached lights on or off. Useful for annoying facelights.
check_box.name: RenderOtherAttachedLights

check_box.label: Render Own Attached Lights
check_box.tool_tip: <icon>Stat_Dot0</icon> Performance <icon>Stat_Dot1</icon> Graphics <icon>ToolTip_Spacer</icon>This option toggles rendering your own attached lights on or off.
check_box.name: RenderOwnAttachedLights

check_box.label: Render Environment Map
check_box.tool_tip: <icon>Stat_Dot0</icon> Performance <icon>Stat_Dot1</icon> Graphics <icon>ToolTip_Spacer</icon>This option toggles rendering the cheap and outdated environment map on shiny surfaces in Deferred Rendering on or off.
check_box.name: RenderDeferredEnvironmentMap

check_box.label: Render High Precision Normals
check_box.tool_tip: <icon>Stat_Dot0</icon> Performance <icon>Stat_Dot1</icon> Graphics <icon>ToolTip_Spacer</icon>This option toggles whether the Viewer should use high precision normal buffers or not. This directly affects the accuracy of light reflections on objects most noticably those of projector images. This increase memory usage by a varying amount depending on your screen resolution. To see the effects of this option you have to toggle Deferred Rendering off and on again.
check_box.name: RenderHighPrecisionNormals

check_box.label: Render Projector Image Reflections
check_box.tool_tip: <icon>Stat_Dot0</icon> Performance <icon>Stat_Dot1</icon> Graphics <icon>ToolTip_Spacer</icon>This option toggles rendering the projector image reflections on shiny surfaces with environment reflections enabled on or off.
check_box.name: RenderSpotLightReflections

check_box.label: Render Spotlight Light Refraction
check_box.tool_tip: <icon>Stat_Dot0</icon> Performance <icon>Stat_Dot1</icon> Graphics <icon>ToolTip_Spacer</icon>This option toggles rendering the light a projector projects into its set direction on or off.
check_box.name: RenderSpotLightImages

radio_item.label: Disabled
radio_item.tool_tip: <icon>Stat_Dot0</icon> Performance <icon>Stat_Dot0</icon> Graphics <icon>ToolTip_Spacer</icon>This option disables antialiasing. It will cause jagged edges.

radio_item.label: FXAA
radio_item.tool_tip: <icon>Stat_Dot0</icon> Performance <icon>Stat_Dot2</icon> Graphics <icon>ToolTip_Spacer</icon>This option enables fast approximate antialiasing. A cheap antialiasing reliably getting rid of jagged edges with no performance cost.

radio_item.label: Disabled
radio_item.tool_tip: <icon>Stat_Dot0</icon> Performance <icon>Stat_Dot0</icon> Graphics <icon>ToolTip_Spacer</icon>This option disables all realtime shadows.

radio_item.label: Sun/Moon
radio_item.tool_tip: <icon>Stat_Dot2</icon> Performance <icon>Stat_Dot3</icon> Graphics <icon>ToolTip_Spacer</icon>This option allows only the sun and moon to cast a global shadow.

radio_item.label: Projectors
radio_item.tool_tip: <icon>Stat_Dot3</icon> Performance <icon>Stat_Dot4</icon> Graphics <icon>ToolTip_Spacer</icon>This option allows projectors to cast shadows. Includes sun and moon shadows.

check_box.label: Automatic Shadow Distance
check_box.tool_tip: <icon>Stat_Dot0</icon> Performance <icon>Stat_Dot1</icon> Graphics <icon>ToolTip_Spacer</icon>This option toggles whether the four shadow distance planes should be automatically calculated or set manually.
check_box.name: RenderShadowAutomaticDistance

slider.label: Closest Shadow Distance:
slider.tool_tip: <icon>Stat_Dot1</icon> Performance <icon>Stat_Dot2</icon> Graphics <icon>ToolTip_Spacer</icon>This option controls the space in meters the first and closest shadowmap covers. Affects precision of shadows in the first of four areas all shadows cover.
slider.name: RenderShadowDistance_X

slider.label: Shadow Distance:
slider.tool_tip: <icon>Stat_Dot1</icon> Performance <icon>Stat_Dot2</icon> Graphics <icon>ToolTip_Spacer</icon>This option roughly controls the space in meters all shadowmaps cover. Affects precision of shadows in all four areas all shadows cover.
slider.name: RenderShadowFarClip

slider.label: Close Shadow Distance:
slider.tool_tip: <icon>Stat_Dot1</icon> Performance <icon>Stat_Dot2</icon> Graphics <icon>ToolTip_Spacer</icon>This option controls the space in meters the second shadowmap covers. Affects precision of shadows in the second of four areas all shadows cover.
slider.name: RenderShadowDistance_Y

slider.label: Far Shadow Distance:
slider.tool_tip: <icon>Stat_Dot1</icon> Performance <icon>Stat_Dot2</icon> Graphics <icon>ToolTip_Spacer</icon>This option controls the space in meters the third shadowmap covers. Affects precision of shadows in the third of four areas all shadows cover.
slider.name: RenderShadowDistance_Z

slider.label: Distant Shadow Distance:
slider.tool_tip: <icon>Stat_Dot1</icon> Performance <icon>Stat_Dot2</icon> Graphics <icon>ToolTip_Spacer</icon>This option controls the space in meters the fourth and last shadowmap covers. Affects precision of shadows in the last of four areas all shadows cover.
slider.name: RenderShadowDistance_W

slider.label: Closeup Shadowmap Size:
slider.tool_tip: <icon>Stat_Dot2</icon> Performance <icon>Stat_Dot3</icon> Graphics <icon>ToolTip_Spacer</icon>This option controls the resolution of the first and closest shadowmap. Affects precision of shadows in the first quarter of your desired shadow distance.
slider.name: RenderShadowResolution_X

slider.label: Close Shadowmap Size:
slider.tool_tip: <icon>Stat_Dot2</icon> Performance <icon>Stat_Dot3</icon> Graphics <icon>ToolTip_Spacer</icon>This option controls the resolution of the second shadowmap. Affects precision of shadows in the second quarter of your desired shadow distance.
slider.name: RenderShadowResolution_Y

slider.label: Far Shadowmap Size:
slider.tool_tip: <icon>Stat_Dot2</icon> Performance <icon>Stat_Dot2</icon> Graphics <icon>ToolTip_Spacer</icon>This option controls the resolution of the third shadowmap. Affects precision of shadows in the third quarter of your desired shadow distance.
slider.name: RenderShadowResolution_Z

slider.label: Distant Shadowmap Size:
slider.tool_tip: <icon>Stat_Dot2</icon> Performance <icon>Stat_Dot1</icon> Graphics <icon>ToolTip_Spacer</icon>This option controls the resolution of the last and furthest shadowmap. Affects precision of shadows in the last quarter of your desired shadow distance.
slider.name: RenderShadowResolution_W

slider.label: First Projector:
slider.tool_tip: <icon>Stat_Dot2</icon> Performance <icon>Stat_Dot2</icon> Graphics <icon>ToolTip_Spacer</icon>This option controls the resolution of the first projector shadowmap. Affects the precision of the first projector and might cause artifacts if set too low.
slider.name: RenderProjectorShadowResolution_X

slider.label: Second Projector:
slider.tool_tip: <icon>Stat_Dot2</icon> Performance <icon>Stat_Dot2</icon> Graphics <icon>ToolTip_Spacer</icon>This option controls the resolution of the second projector shadowmap. Affects the precision of the second projector and might cause artifacts if set too low.
slider.name: RenderProjectorShadowResolution_Y

check_box.label: Light Softening
check_box.tool_tip: <icon>Stat_Dot2</icon> Performance <icon>Stat_Dot3</icon> Graphics <icon>ToolTip_Spacer</icon>This option toggles blurring for the light image used in Deferred Rendering. Affects whether shadows and SSAO are softened.
check_box.name: RenderDeferredBlurLight

slider.label: Soften Blur Size:
slider.tool_tip: This option control the strength of each blur light pass. Higher values mean softer but also wider blur.
slider.name: RenderShadowBlurSize

slider.label: Global Light Strength:
slider.tool_tip: This option control the brightness of all lights in the scene regardless whether they are spotlights or pointlights.
slider.name: RenderGlobalLightStrength

check_box.label: Render Screen Space Reflections
check_box.tool_tip: <icon>Stat_Dot4</icon> Performance <icon>Stat_Dot3</icon> Graphics <icon>ToolTip_Spacer</icon>This option toggles cheap looking but performance costly reflections based on a copy what you see on screen.
check_box.name: RenderScreenSpaceReflections

slider.tool_tip: <icon>Stat_Dot5</icon> Performance <icon>Stat_Dot3</icon> Graphics <icon>ToolTip_Spacer</icon>This option controls the amount of iterations the screen space reflection shader should go through. More iterations mean finer grained reflections but also much higher performance impact.
slider.label: SSR Resolution:
slider.name: RenderSSRResolution

slider.tool_tip: This option controls the brightness of reflections on shiny surfaces from Screen Space Reflections.
slider.label: SSR Brightness:
slider.name: RenderSSRBrightness

check_box.label: Screen Space Ambient Occlusion (SSAO)
check_box.tool_tip: <icon>Stat_Dot1</icon> Performance <icon>Stat_Dot3</icon> Graphics <icon>ToolTip_Spacer</icon>This option toggles Screen Space Ambient Occlusion (SSAO) emulating indirect lighting and the lack thereof giving objects a more realistic, less flat look.
check_box.name: UseSSAO

slider.label: SSAO Blur Size:
slider.tool_tip: This option controls the strength of each blur pass of SSAO.
slider.name: RenderSSAOBlurSize

slider.tool_tip: This option controls the strength and thus darkness of each pixel of SSAO.
slider.label: SSAO Effect:
slider.name: SSAOEffect

slider.tool_tip: This option controls the size of the area SSAO is applied in, higher is a wider but weaker SSAO.
slider.label: SSAO Scale:
slider.name: SSAOScale

slider.tool_tip: This option controls the maximum size of the area SSAO is applied in, if max scale is smaller than scale it will be cut off creating a harsher SSAO outline.
slider.label: SSAO Max Scale:
slider.name: SSAOMaxScale

slider.tool_tip: This option controls the distance one object needs to be away from another to be eligible for SSAO, higher means more SSAO on objects further away from each other, possibly resulting in black ghost outlines around objects and avatars.
slider.label: SSAO Factor:
slider.name: SSAOFactor

check_box.label: Depth of Field
check_box.tool_tip: <icon>Stat_Dot2</icon> Performance <icon>Stat_Dot2</icon> Graphics <icon>ToolTip_Spacer</icon>This option toggles Depth of Field on or off, it is often used to blur out the background or unfocused parts of the scene.
check_box.name: UseDoF

check_box.label: Enable Alphas in Depth of Field calculations
check_box.tool_tip: This option toggle if the Viewer should include alphas and particles into the depth map. This will affect whether alpha transparent surfaces block godrays and if said surface is considered a solid surface when blurring.
check_box.name: RenderDepthOfFieldAlphas

check_box.label: Enable High Quality Depth of Field
check_box.tool_tip: <icon>Stat_Dot4</icon> Performance <icon>Stat_Dot3</icon> Graphics <icon>ToolTip_Spacer</icon>This option toggles between the old, slow, high quality Depth of Field and the new, faster, lower quality Depth of Field.
check_box.name: RenderDepthOfFieldHighQuality

slider.label: Field of View(°):
slider.name: CameraFOV
slider.tool_tip: This option controls the vertical camera field of view in ° (Degrees) for Depth of Field.

slider.label: F-Number:
slider.name: CameraFNum
slider.tool_tip: This option controls the camera f-number value for Depth of Field.

slider.label: Focal Length(mm):
slider.name: CameraFocal
slider.tool_tip: This option controls the camera focal length in mm (Millimeters) for Depth of Field.

slider.label: Circle of Confusion:
slider.name: CameraCoF
slider.tool_tip: This option controls the camera circle of confusion for Depth of Field.

slider.label: Focus Transition Time(s):
slider.name: CameraFocusTrans
slider.tool_tip: This option controls the time in s (Seconds) it takes to switch focus from one point to another.

slider.label: Resolution Scale:
slider.name: CameraDoFRes
slider.tool_tip: <icon>Stat_Dot4</icon> Performance <icon>Stat_Dot3</icon> Graphics <icon>ToolTip_Spacer</icon>This option controls the sampling resolution for Depth of Field. It multiplies the current screen resolution with this number, lower means less accurate.

check_box.label: Motion Blur
check_box.tool_tip: <icon>Stat_Dot2</icon> Performance <icon>Stat_Dot2</icon> Graphics <icon>ToolTip_Spacer</icon>This option toggles whether the Viewer should blur fast movement.
check_box.name: MotionBlur

icon.name: warning_blur_quality
icon.tool_tip: WARNING: Motion Blur may look too strong and noticeable a low Motion Blur Quality setting.

radio_item.label: Objects
radio_item.tool_tip: <icon>Stat_Dot1</icon> Performance <icon>Stat_Dot1</icon> Graphics <icon>ToolTip_Spacer</icon>This option allows only objects with fast movement to be blurred.

radio_item.label: Self
radio_item.tool_tip: <icon>Stat_Dot1</icon> Performance <icon>Stat_Dot2</icon> Graphics <icon>ToolTip_Spacer</icon>This option allows objects and your own avatar to be blurred.

radio_item.label: Everything
radio_item.tool_tip: <icon>Stat_Dot2</icon> Performance <icon>Stat_Dot2</icon> Graphics <icon>ToolTip_Spacer</icon>This option allows everything moving fast to be blurred.

slider.tool_tip: This option controls the strength divisor used for Motion Blur, higher means weaker and smoother blur.
slider.label: Blur Quality:
slider.name: MotionBlurQuality

check_box.label: Volumetric Lighting
check_box.tool_tip: <icon>Stat_Dot1</icon> Performance <icon>Stat_Dot3</icon> Graphics <icon>ToolTip_Spacer</icon>This option toggles experimental volumetric lighting. This effect will create godrays if certain atmospheric criteria are met.
check_box.name: RenderGodrays

icon.name: warning_light_resolution
icon.tool_tip: WARNING: A high volumetric light resolution may have medium performance impact depending on the scene and shadow resolution.

check_box.label: Directional Volumetric Lighting
check_box.tool_tip: This option controls whether Volumtric Lighting should fade out when looking away from the sun.
check_box.name: RenderGodraysDirectional

slider.tool_tip: <icon>Stat_Dot3</icon> Performance <icon>Stat_Dot1</icon> Graphics <icon>ToolTip_Spacer</icon>This option controls the amount of iterations Volumetric Lighting goes through, higher looks better but is slower. Performance impact also depends on shadow resolution.
slider.label: Light Resolution:
slider.name: GodraysResolution

slider.tool_tip: This option controls the brightness of each Volumetric Lighting iteration.
slider.label: Light Brightness:
slider.name: GodraysMultiplier

slider.tool_tip: This option controls the strength and distance at which Volumetric Lighting should be faded out around your camera.
slider.label: Light Falloff:
slider.name: GodraysFalloffMultiplier

check_box.label: Lens Flare Effect
check_box.tool_tip: <icon>Stat_Dot0</icon> Performance <icon>Stat_Dot1</icon> Graphics <icon>ToolTip_Spacer</icon>This option toggles a lens reflection of the sun in your camera on or off.
check_box.name: LensFlare

slider.tool_tip: This option controls the percentage the screen should be decolored.
slider.label: Greyscale Strength:
slider.name: GreyscaleStrength

slider.tool_tip: This option controls the percentage the screen colors should be transformed to a Sepia color palette.
slider.label: Sepia Strength:
slider.name: SepiaStrength

slider.tool_tip: This option controls the amount of times all colors onscreen should be posterized.
slider.label: Posterize Samples:
slider.name: PosterizeSamples

slider.tool_tip: This option controls the offset of the edge color fringing.
slider.label: Chromatic Aberration:
slider.name: ChromaStrength

check_box.label: Tone Mapping
check_box.tool_tip: <icon>Stat_Dot0</icon> Performance <icon>Stat_Dot3</icon> Graphics <icon>ToolTip_Spacer</icon>This option toggles Tone Mapping on or off. It is used to transform colors that are outside the visible range into a color range that most monitors can display while trying to keep the details of the scene such as the contrast intact, in short it compresses the whole color range which is partly not visible into one that can be displayed.
check_box.name: ToneMapping

radio_item.label: Filmic
radio_item.tool_tip: This option switches the Tone Mapping algorythm to 'Filmic'.

radio_item.label: Linear
radio_item.tool_tip: This option switches the Tone Mapping algorythm to 'Linear', similar to 'Custom' but without customizations.

radio_item.label: Rheinard
radio_item.tool_tip: This option switches the Tone Mapping algorythm to 'Rheinard'.

radio_item.label: Custom
radio_item.tool_tip: This option switches allows full control over the weights of the Tone Mapping algorythm.

slider.tool_tip: This option controls the exposure or overall brightness for Tone Mapping.
slider.label: Tone Exposure:
slider.name: ExodusRenderToneExposure

slider.tool_tip: This option controls the shoulder strength for Tone Mapping.
slider.label: Shoulder Strength:
slider.name: ExodusRenderToneAdvOptA_X

slider.tool_tip: This option controls the linear strength for Tone Mapping.
slider.label: Linear Strength:
slider.name: ExodusRenderToneAdvOptA_Y

slider.tool_tip: This option controls the linear angle for Tone Mapping.
slider.label: Linear Angle:
slider.name: ExodusRenderToneAdvOptA_Z

slider.tool_tip: This option controls the toe strength for Tone Mapping.
slider.label: Toe Strength:
slider.name: ExodusRenderToneAdvOptB_X

slider.tool_tip: This option controls the the numerator for Tone Mapping.
slider.label: Toe Numerator:
slider.name: ExodusRenderToneAdvOptB_Y

slider.tool_tip: This option controls the toe denominator for Tone Mapping.
slider.label: Toe Denominator:
slider.name: ExodusRenderToneAdvOptB_Z

slider.tool_tip: This option controls the linear white for Tone Mapping.
slider.label: Linear White:
slider.name: ExodusRenderToneAdvOptC_X

slider.tool_tip: This option controls the exposure bias for Tone Mapping.
slider.label: Exposure Bias:
slider.name: ExodusRenderToneAdvOptC_Y

radio_item.label: None
radio_item.tool_tip: <icon>Stat_Dot0</icon> Performance <icon>Stat_Dot1</icon> Graphics <icon>ToolTip_Spacer</icon>This option disables Color Correction.

radio_item.label: Linear
radio_item.tool_tip: <icon>Stat_Dot0</icon> Performance <icon>Stat_Dot3</icon> Graphics <icon>ToolTip_Spacer</icon>This option enables linear Color Correction and allows altering the algorythm.

slider.tool_tip: This option controls how much the red color channel should be exposed.
slider.label: Exposure Red:
slider.name: ExodusRenderExposure_X

slider.tool_tip: This option controls how much the green color channel should be exposed.
slider.label: Exposure Green:
slider.name: ExodusRenderExposure_Y

slider.tool_tip: This option controls how much the blue color channel should be exposed.
slider.label: Exposure Blue:
slider.name: ExodusRenderExposure_Z

slider.tool_tip: This option controls how much the red color channel should be offsetted.
slider.label: Offset Red:
slider.name: ExodusRenderOffset_X

slider.tool_tip: This option controls how much the green color channel should be offsetted.
slider.label: Offset Green:
slider.name: ExodusRenderOffset_Y

slider.tool_tip: This option controls how much the blue color channel should be offsetted.
slider.label: Offset Blue:
slider.name: ExodusRenderOffset_Z

slider.tool_tip: This option controls how much gamma the red color channel should use.
slider.label: Gamma Red:
slider.name: ExodusRenderGamma_X

slider.tool_tip: This option controls how much gamma the green color channel should use.
slider.label: Gamma Green:
slider.name: ExodusRenderGamma_Y

slider.tool_tip: This option controls how much gamma the blue color channel should use.
slider.label: Gamma Blue:
slider.name: ExodusRenderGamma_Z

slider.tool_tip: This option controls the overall size of the vignette effect.
slider.label: Amount:
slider.name: ExodusRenderVignette_X

slider.tool_tip: This option controls the overall strength of the vignette effect.
slider.label: Power:
slider.name: ExodusRenderVignette_Y

slider.tool_tip: This option multiplies both size and strength of the vignette effect.
slider.label: Multiplier:
slider.name: ExodusRenderVignette_Z

panel.name: warning_bg_panel

icon.name: warning_intel_gpu
icon.tool_tip: WARNING: You are using an Intel Graphics Card, Deferred Rendering is not available, this makes up 80% of the Viewer's graphical capabilities. Please consult the internet on how to enable your dedicated graphics card if your computer has one, you may ask secondlife:///app/agent/a7fe20fa-1e95-4f87-aa8f-86496c78c1e5/about.

panel.text: <red>Intel Graphics Card detected</red> - Performance will be impacted.
